title: Pears & Arugula Wrapped In Prosciutto
summary: Pears & Arugula Wrapped In Prosciutto might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe serves 12 and costs 53 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 2g of protein, 5g of fat, and a total of 70 calories. Head to the store and pick up arugula, comice pears, prosciutto, and a few other things to make it today. This recipe from finecooking.com has 1 fans. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 9%. This score is very bad (but still fixable). Try Prosciutto-Wrapped Pears, Prosciutto-Wrapped Pears, and Prosciutto with Pears and Arugula for similar recipes.
instructions: Lay a piece of prosciutto on a flat surface and put an arugula leaf down the center. Put a pear wedge in the center of the arugula. Drape each end of the prosciutto over the pear. Arrange the pears, sticking outward, on a platter in a circular pattern, with arugula or fresh herbs in the center, if you like. This may be made 2 hours ahead, covered with plastic wrap, and refrigerated.                  nutrition information (per serving):        Size                        :                      per piece, Calories                        (kcal):                      60, Fat                        (kcal):                      1.5, Fat Calories                        (g):                      16, Saturated Fat                        (g):                      0.5, Protein                        (g):                      5, Monounsaturated Fat                        (g):                      0.5, Carbohydrates                        (mg):                      5, Polyunsaturated Fat                        (mg):                      0, Sodium                        (g):                      470, Cholesterol                        (g):                      10, Fiber                        (g):                      1,                     Photo: Mark Thomas          Rate this Recipe and View Reviews

steps.step: Lay a piece of prosciutto on a flat surface and put an arugula leaf down the center. Put a pear wedge in the center of the arugula. Drape each end of the prosciutto over the pear. Arrange the pears, sticking outward, on a platter in a circular pattern, with arugula or fresh herbs in the center, if you like. This may be made 2 hours ahead, covered with plastic wrap, and refrigerated.
